text: George's Brook is a village located north of Clarenville. The town was unincorporated and was a Local service district with the neighboring community of Milton. In 1950, when it became a Canada Post Office, the first Postmistress was Mona Pelley. By 1956 it had a population of 197. The first Way-master in October 1985 was Charles Pelley. In 2017, the community voted in favor of joining with Milton to incorporating into the town of George's Brook- Milton. The provincial government approved the incorporation in 2018. ==References== Category:Populated coastal places in Canada Category:Designated places in Newfoundland and Labrador
title: George's Brook, Newfoundland and Labrador
